Title: [Job Groups][Job Groups]Verify  Global search with Job Reference ID
Description: Test case to verify global search functionality using Job Reference ID for locating specific jobs across all job groups
Precondition: 1. User logged in; 2. Global search input visible in header; 3. Valid Job Reference ID exists in system
Steps: 1. Navigate to global search input in header; 2. Focus on search input field; 3. Enter valid Job Reference ID (e.g., JOB-12345); 4. Verify search term is displayed correctly; 5. Press Enter or click Search button; 6. Wait for search results to load; 7. Verify search execution completes
Expected Result: 1. Global search input field is focused and ready for input; 2. Search term is clearly visible in input field; 3. Job Reference ID is entered correctly; 4. Search term validation passes; 5. Search action is triggered successfully; 6. Search results load within acceptable timeframe; 7. User is redirected to relevant job group view with matching job highlighted

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  Global search with Load Reference ID
Description: Test case to verify global search functionality using Load Reference ID for locating specific loads across all job groups
Precondition: 1. User logged in; 2. Global search input visible in header; 3. Valid Load Reference ID exists in system
Steps: 1. Navigate to global search input in header; 2. Focus on search input field; 3. Enter valid Load Reference ID (e.g., LOAD-67890); 4. Verify search term is displayed correctly; 5. Press Enter or click Search button; 6. Wait for search results to load; 7. Verify search execution completes
Expected Result: 1. Global search input field is focused and ready for input; 2. Search term is clearly visible in input field; 3. Load Reference ID is entered correctly; 4. Search term validation passes; 5. Search action is triggered successfully; 6. Search results load within acceptable timeframe; 7. User is redirected to relevant job group view with matching load/job file highlighted

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  in-group search supports Job Ref ID and Load Ref ID
Description: Test case to verify in-group search functionality supports both Job Reference ID and Load Reference ID filtering
Precondition: 1. User is within a selected Job Group; 2. Job Ref ID and Load Ref ID exist in current group; 3. Search functionality is accessible
Steps: 1. Open a Job Group from the left panel; 2. Locate the Job Group search field (scope = current group); 3. Enter Job Ref ID (JOB-12345) in search field; 4. Verify search results are filtered within selected group; 5. Clear search and enter Load Ref ID (LOAD-67890); 6. Verify results are filtered correctly; 7. Confirm no cross-group leakage occurs
Expected Result: 1. Job Group opens successfully from left panel; 2. In-group search field is accessible and functional; 3. Job Ref ID search returns matching items within group; 4. Results are filtered correctly within selected Job Group; 5. Load Ref ID search returns matching items within group; 6. No results show appropriate empty state message; 7. Search maintains group scope boundaries correctly

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  initial load lists all Job Groups in left panel
Description: Test case to verify that all available Job Groups are displayed in the left panel on initial page load
Precondition: 1. At least one custom job group exists; 2. User has access to Job Groups page; 3. Page loads without errors
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Groups page; 2. Wait for page to fully load; 3. Observe left panel content on first paint; 4. Verify all available Job Groups are listed; 5. Check default selection behavior; 6. Verify group count matches expected; 7. Confirm panel responsiveness
Expected Result: 1. Job Groups page loads successfully; 2. Page renders completely without loading errors; 3. Left panel displays all available Job Groups; 4. All custom job groups are visible and accessible; 5. Default selection matches PROD behavior; 6. Group count is accurate and complete; 7. Left panel responds to user interactions properly

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  'Group name' is READ ONLY when creating a job inside a selected group
Description: Test case to verify that Group name field is pre-filled and read-only when creating jobs within a selected group context
Precondition: 1. User has selected a Job Group in left panel; 2. Create Job functionality is accessible; 3. User has permissions to create jobs
Steps: 1. Select a Job Group from the left panel; 2. Click '+ Create Job' from within the selected group context; 3. Observe the Create Job modal appearance; 4. Locate the 'Group name' field in the modal; 5. Verify field is pre-filled with selected group name; 6. Attempt to edit the Group name field; 7. Confirm field remains read-only
Expected Result: 1. Job Group selection is maintained in left panel; 2. Create Job modal opens successfully; 3. Modal displays all required fields correctly; 4. Group name field is visible and accessible; 5. Group name field is pre-filled with selected group name; 6. User cannot change the group from this field; 7. Field maintains read-only state throughout modal session

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  redirect to Job Summary after creating a job within a group
Description: Test case to verify automatic redirection to Job Summary page after successful job creation within a group
Precondition: 1. User inside a selected Job Group; 2. Mandatory fields can be filled; 3. Create Job functionality is accessible
Steps: 1. Open Create Job modal in selected group; 2. Fill minimum required fields (Job Type, Customer, Contract, etc.); 3. Verify all mandatory fields are completed; 4. Review job creation details; 5. Submit the job creation form; 6. Wait for system processing; 7. Verify redirection behavior
Expected Result: 1. Create Job modal opens successfully in selected group context; 2. All mandatory fields are filled with valid data; 3. Form validation passes without errors; 4. Job creation details are accurate and complete; 5. Form submission proceeds without blocking; 6. System processes job creation successfully; 7. User is automatically redirected to Job Summary (next page) of creation flow

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  creating a new Job Group populates left panel and 'Select Group' dropdown
Description: Test case to verify that newly created Job Groups appear immediately in both left panel and Create Job modal dropdown
Precondition: 1. User at Job Groups page; 2. Create Group functionality is accessible; 3. User has permissions to create groups
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Groups page; 2. Click '+ Add Group' button; 3. Enter new group name (e.g., 'MARCH-EXPORT-2025'); 4. Submit the group creation form; 5. Verify new group appears in left panel; 6. Open 'Select Group' dropdown in Create Job modal; 7. Confirm new group is available in dropdown
Expected Result: 1. Job Groups page loads successfully; 2. Add Group functionality is accessible; 3. Group creation form opens correctly; 4. New group name is accepted and processed; 5. New group appears immediately in left panel; 6. Create Job modal opens successfully; 7. New group is available in 'Select Group' dropdown

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  clicking a job file opens relevant page (JPM/Load Mgmt/Job Summary)
Description: Test case to verify that clicking on job file names navigates to appropriate detail pages based on job type and configuration
Precondition: 1. At least one job exists in the list; 2. Job files are clickable; 3. Navigation functionality is working
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Groups page; 2. Locate a job file in the right pane; 3. Verify job file name is clickable; 4. Click on the job file name; 5. Wait for navigation to complete; 6. Verify correct detail page loads; 7. Confirm page content matches job type
Expected Result: 1. Job Groups page loads with job files visible; 2. Job file names are displayed as clickable elements; 3. Cursor changes to pointer on hover; 4. Click action is registered successfully; 5. Navigation proceeds without errors; 6. User is taken to relevant detail page for that job; 7. Page content and functionality match job type and configuration

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  'Create a new Job' and 'Create a new Job Group' from Home page
Description: Test case to verify that both job and job group creation flows function correctly when accessed from Home page
Precondition: 1. User at Home page; 2. Create functionality is accessible; 3. User has appropriate permissions
Steps: 1. Navigate to Home page; 2. Locate 'Create a new Job' option; 3. Click 'Create a new Job' from Home; 4. Verify job creation flow opens; 5. Return to Home page; 6. Click 'Create a new Job Group' and create one; 7. Confirm group creation completes
Expected Result: 1. Home page loads successfully with all options visible; 2. Create a new Job option is accessible; 3. Job creation flow opens without errors; 4. Job creation functionality works as expected; 5. Home page navigation works correctly; 6. Create a new Job Group option is accessible; 7. Both flows function as in existing implementation with no UI or validation errors

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  global search navigates to the relevant Job Group
Description: Test case to verify that global search automatically navigates to Job Groups page and selects the group containing the search match
Precondition: 1. Job exists in a non-default group; 2. Global search is functional; 3. User has access to Job Groups page
Steps: 1. Navigate to any page with global search accessible; 2. Locate global search input field; 3. Enter search term (Job/Load/Order/Other Ref ID); 4. Submit the search; 5. Wait for search processing; 6. Verify navigation behavior; 7. Confirm group selection and job highlighting
Expected Result: 1. Global search input field is accessible and functional; 2. Search term is entered correctly; 3. Search submission is processed successfully; 4. System processes global search without errors; 5. Search results are found and processed; 6. System opens Job Groups page automatically; 7. Relevant group is auto-selected and job appears highlighted/visible

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  in-group search supports Order Reference ID and Other Reference ID
Description: Test case to verify that in-group search functionality supports Order Reference ID and Other Reference ID filtering within selected groups
Precondition: 1. User is within a selected Job Group; 2. Order Ref ID and Other Ref ID exist in current group; 3. In-group search is functional
Steps: 1. Open selected Job Group from left panel; 2. Locate in-group search functionality; 3. Enter Order Ref ID (ORD-1122) in search field; 4. Verify search results are filtered correctly; 5. Clear search and enter Other Ref ID (OTH-3344); 6. Verify results are filtered within group; 7. Confirm search maintains group boundaries
Expected Result: 1. Selected Job Group opens successfully; 2. In-group search field is accessible and functional; 3. Order Ref ID search returns matching items; 4. Results are filtered correctly within selected group; 5. Other Ref ID search returns matching items; 6. All results remain within group boundaries; 7. Search functionality maintains proper scope and filtering

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  left bar Job Groups filter reacts to in-group search terms and right pane shows exact job file(s)
Description: Test case to verify that left panel Job Groups filter updates based on search terms and right pane displays exact matching job files
Precondition: 1. Multiple groups exist; 2. At least one match exists across groups; 3. Search functionality is working
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Groups page; 2. Locate left bar 'Job Group search filter'; 3. Enter an ID term (Order/Other/Job/Load) in search filter; 4. Observe left groups list updates; 5. Verify only relevant groups are displayed; 6. Observe right pane job list updates; 7. Confirm exact matching job files are shown
Expected Result: 1. Job Groups page loads with multiple groups visible; 2. Left bar search filter is accessible and functional; 3. Search filter processes ID terms correctly; 4. Left panel updates to show only relevant Job Groups containing matches; 5. Group filtering works accurately; 6. Right pane updates to show matching job files; 7. Exact matching job file(s) are displayed correctly

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  Job Master filter supports Order/Other/Job/Load IDs and lists matching jobs
Description: Test case to verify that Job Master filter functionality supports all ID types and returns accurate results without cross-group leakage
Precondition: 1. User navigated to Job Master; 2. Multiple jobs exist across different groups; 3. Filter functionality is accessible
Steps: 1. Open Job Master page; 2. Locate filter functionality; 3. Use filter with Order ID (ORD-1122) individually; 4. Apply filter and verify results; 5. Use filter with Other ID (OTH-3344) individually; 6. Use filter with Job ID (JOB-12345) individually; 7. Use filter with Load ID (LOAD-67890) individually
Expected Result: 1. Job Master page opens successfully; 2. Filter functionality is accessible and functional; 3. Order ID filter returns matching jobs with correct counts; 4. Filter results are accurate and relevant; 5. Other ID filter returns matching jobs with correct counts; 6. Job ID filter returns matching jobs with correct counts; 7. Load ID filter returns matching jobs with correct counts; No cross-group leakage occurs

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  kebab menu is visible for each Job Group row/card
Description: Test case to verify that kebab menu (three-dot menu) is visible and accessible for each Job Group in the left panel
Precondition: 1. Job Groups page loaded with multiple groups; 2. Kebab menu functionality is enabled; 3. User has appropriate permissions
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Groups page; 2. Wait for page to fully load; 3. Observe each Job Group in left panel; 4. Locate kebab menu icons for each group; 5. Hover over group header to reveal kebab menu; 6. Verify menu icon is present; 7. Confirm menu accessibility
Expected Result: 1. Job Groups page loads completely with all groups visible; 2. Left panel displays all available Job Groups; 3. Each Job Group row/card is properly rendered; 4. Kebab menu icons are visible for every group; 5. Hover actions reveal kebab menu options; 6. Kebab menu icon is present and accessible for every Job Group; 7. Menu functionality is consistent across all groups

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  'Rename' option shows existing Rename Group popup
Description: Test case to verify that Rename option in kebab menu opens the existing rename popup and functions correctly
Precondition: 1. Kebab menu available for a group; 2. Rename functionality is enabled; 3. User has rename permissions
Steps: 1. Open kebab menu for a selected Job Group; 2. Locate and click 'Rename' option; 3. Verify rename popup appears; 4. Type a valid new group name (e.g., 'EXPORT-MAR-2025'); 5. Confirm the rename action; 6. Verify group is renamed; 7. Confirm UI updates and success notification
Expected Result: 1. Kebab menu opens successfully for selected group; 2. Rename option is visible and clickable; 3. Existing rename popup opens correctly; 4. New group name can be entered in popup; 5. Rename confirmation is processed successfully; 6. Group is renamed and left panel updates; 7. Success toast is displayed confirming rename action

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  'Delete' option is disabled when Job Group contains at least one job
Description: Test case to verify that Delete option is properly disabled for non-empty Job Groups to prevent accidental deletion
Precondition: 1. Pick a non-empty group; 2. Group contains at least one job; 3. Kebab menu is accessible
Steps: 1. Select a Job Group that contains at least one job; 2. Open kebab menu for the selected group; 3. Locate the 'Delete' option in menu; 4. Observe the visual state of Delete option; 5. Attempt to click on Delete option; 6. Verify no action occurs; 7. Confirm option remains disabled
Expected Result: 1. Non-empty Job Group is selected successfully; 2. Kebab menu opens for selected group; 3. Delete option is visible in menu; 4. Delete option appears disabled (grayed out); 5. Click attempt on Delete option is ignored; 6. No deletion action occurs; 7. Delete option remains disabled throughout session

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  deleting an empty Job Group via confirmation dialog
Description: Test case to verify that empty Job Groups can be deleted through proper confirmation dialog workflow
Precondition: 1. Choose a Job Group with 0 jobs; 2. Delete functionality is enabled; 3. User has delete permissions
Steps: 1. Select an empty Job Group (0 jobs); 2. Open kebab menu for the empty group; 3. Click 'Delete' option in kebab menu; 4. Verify warning popup appears with confirmation dialog; 5. Confirm warning message: 'Are you sure you want to delete this job group?' with Yes/No options; 6. Click 'Yes' to confirm deletion; 7. Verify deletion completes successfully
Expected Result: 1. Empty Job Group is selected successfully; 2. Kebab menu opens for empty group; 3. Delete option is enabled and clickable; 4. Warning popup appears with proper confirmation dialog; 5. Confirmation message is clear and actionable; 6. Yes/No options are functional; 7. Group is deleted successfully; Left panel updates; Success notification displayed

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  Delete confirmation 'No' returns to previous state without changes
Description: Test case to verify that clicking 'No' in delete confirmation dialog returns to previous state without any changes
Precondition: 1. Choose an empty group; 2. Delete confirmation dialog is accessible; 3. No action has been taken yet
Steps: 1. Select an empty Job Group for deletion; 2. Open kebab menu and click 'Delete'; 3. Verify warning popup appears with Yes/No options; 4. In warning popup, click 'No' option; 5. Observe popup behavior; 6. Verify no deletion occurs; 7. Confirm UI state remains unchanged
Expected Result: 1. Empty Job Group is selected for deletion; 2. Delete option opens warning popup correctly; 3. Warning popup displays Yes/No confirmation options; 4. No option is clicked successfully; 5. Popup closes without deletion action; 6. No deletion occurs; 7. UI state remains unchanged from previous state

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  'Move Job File' dropdown lists ALL Job Groups regardless of current filter
Description: Test case to verify that Move Job File dropdown shows complete list of all Job Groups, not just filtered subset
Precondition: 1. Multiple job groups exist; 2. Current left panel is filtered to a subset; 3. Move Job File functionality is accessible
Steps: 1. Apply a global/left panel filter so only a subset of groups appear; 2. Verify filter is active and working; 3. Open a job file within the filtered group; 4. Locate and click 'Move Job File' option; 5. Open dropdown to view available destination groups; 6. Verify dropdown content; 7. Confirm dropdown lists all available groups
Expected Result: 1. Global/left panel filter is applied successfully; 2. Filter reduces visible groups to subset; 3. Job file opens successfully within filtered group; 4. Move Job File option is accessible and functional; 5. Dropdown opens and displays available groups; 6. Dropdown lists ALL job groups in system (full list); 7. User can select any group and complete the move; After move, job appears under selected destination group
Test Data: SWADESHI-JUN-2025; All groups include many others

Title: [Job Groups]Verify  moving a Job File to any existing group succeeds
Description: Test case to verify that Job File moves between groups complete successfully with proper audit logging and UI updates
Precondition: 1. Job exists in source group; 2. Destination group exists; 3. User has move permissions; 4. Move functionality is accessible
Steps: 1. Open job file in source group (e.g., SWADESHI-JUN-2025); 2. Locate and click 'Move Job File' option; 3. Verify move functionality is accessible; 4. Choose a destination group from full dropdown list; 5. Confirm the move action; 6. Wait for move processing to complete; 7. Verify move success and UI updates
Expected Result: 1. Job file opens successfully in source group; 2. Move Job File option is accessible and functional; 3. Move functionality opens destination selection; 4. Destination group can be selected from dropdown; 5. Move confirmation is processed successfully; 6. Job move completes without errors; 7. Success toast displayed; Job disappears from source group and appears in destination group; Audit log records the move
